methodology: Farm data (ground truth) used to calibrate GDD predictions
keyInsights: Farm 'availability' includes storage, not just harvest window
GDD predicts HARVEST timing, not market availability
Florida has bimodal seasons for warm-season crops (fall + spring)
Cultivar staggering extends apparent window beyond single-cultivar GDD

citrus_orange_FL.notes: Extend window from 2000 to 3500 GDD to cover Oct-May

citrus_tangerine_FL.notes: Earlier maturity, wider window to cover Nov-Feb

strawberry_FL.notes: Extend window through April, peak Feb-Mar

tomato_FL.issue: Florida has FALL (Sept plant, Nov-Jan harvest) and SPRING (Jan plant, Mar-May harvest) seasons
tomato_FL.solution: Model requires TWO bloom/planting events per year for bimodal crops
tomato_FL.notes: Wider window to capture full season, or split into fall/spring models

peach_GA.notes: Multiple cultivars stagger May-Sept, earlier maturity start

apple_MI.issue: Farm data includes STORAGE availability (Jan-May), not harvest
apple_MI.solution: Separate harvest window from storage availability in model
apple_MI.notes: Adjust bloom date and GDD for Sept-Nov harvest; model storage separately

apple_NY.issue: Same as MI - storage months included
apple_NY.notes: Earlier varieties start Aug, extends through Nov

cherry_WA.notes: Multiple cultivars from Rainier to Skeena extend Jun-Aug

cherry_MI.notes: Extend window for tart + sweet cherry varieties

pear_OR.notes: Same as WA - Hood River extends through Oct

storageTracking.description: Separate harvest window from market availability
storageTracking.implementation: Add storage_months field to product model

bimodalSeasons.description: Handle crops with multiple planting seasons per year
bimodalSeasons.implementation: Allow multiple bloom_date entries per crop√óregion

cultivarStaggering.description: Account for multiple cultivars extending harvest window
cultivarStaggering.solution: Wider GDD windows OR cultivar-specific GDD targets

weatherIntegration.description: Replace estimated GDD rates with actual weather data
weatherIntegration.benefit: Actual vs estimated GDD improves prediction accuracy

afterCalibration.notes: Storage vs harvest distinction explains remaining poor fits (apple MI/NY)

expectedWithStorageModel.notes: Storage model will extend availability beyond harvest window

limitations.estimatedVsActualGDD: Using estimated monthly GDD rates instead of actual weather data
limitations.maxTempCapping: Modified 86/50 method (max_temp) not applied to estimated rates
limitations.resolution: Integrate real weather data (Open-Meteo, NOAA) to apply crop-specific temperature caps
